note.p: Education: Royal School of Mines, London; Royal College of Chemistry; Cambridge University

Career: Instructor in Chemistry, Royal School of Naval Architecture (1867); Demonstrator of Chemistry, Cambridge University (1870); Professor of Chemistry, Sydney, Australia (1873-1908); founded the faculty of Science (1879) and the School of Mines (1890), Sydney University; Professor of Geology and Mineralogy, and Hovell Lecturer, Sydney University; retired (1908)
Memberships: FGS; FCS; FLS; Physical Society; FIC
Obituaries: Proc Roy Soc Series A 1930 vol 126 pp xii-xiv, plate, signed by T W E D
References: R W Home, 'The Royal Society and the Empire: the colonial and Commonwealth Fellowship. Part 2. After 1847' in NR 2003 vol 57 pp 47-84
